name: Sønderhav
description:
Toilets closed. says close 23hrs but closed at dusk. winter hours maybe. Will check in morning. 

A small car park right on the coast side with a nice view to Ochseninseln, not far away from Annies Kiosk.

name: Mandemarke Haver primitiv overnatningsplads
description: Official shelter for hikers, cyclers and canoers, provides a campground, 2 shelters, 2 fire pits with grill stand and a toilet. There is a small parking nearby where I slept in the car. Nice folks at the shelter. Campers staying overnight are officially not allowed, so I kept it low profile and stayed at the shelter and fireplace and only went to the car to sleep.

name: Parking near Ribe
description: Just a parking out of sight from the road, with toilet

name: Hadsund Camping
description: Nice campground with all facilitis an overlander needs. One speaks : German, English, Dansk, French and Dutch. Camper service included. No problems for big rigs. p. p. 60 to 80 Dkr. 5 Dkr 4 min for shower. Rooms for 4 person available, 120 to 200 Dkr. Open from 1.5. to 1.10.

name: Färöer-Eidi
description: Campground on former soccer field right at waterfront.

name: Färöer-Selatrao harbour Camping
description: On gravel, directly at the waterfront. Promised WiFi not working while we were here. Run down place, has seen better times. Location is great though.

name: Torshavn Harbour, Faroe Islands
description: This is a stop along the way the ferry between Denmark and Iceland (The Faroe Islands are governed by Denmark).

name: Hirtshals Camping
description: Nice and green Campground directly at the sea. Great view. Lot of space.

name: Torshaven Camping
description: Just 1km away from the ferry. Directly at the sea. Flat gravel spots. Nice View.

name: Giljanes Hostel & Camping
description: Small campground together with the Hostel. Green and also paved pitches. Great view to the sea and the small vilage. 100 DK per person and night.

name: flatnagarõur campsite
description: nice campsite on gravel and with a view over the ocean. Fee includes showers, water, electricity and wifi.

name: ishoj arken parking
description: a big gravel parking in front of a playground near the beach. you can also go see the big troll 1km away

name: odense parking
description: a parking facing the zoo not far from City center

name: hobro by the lake
description:
pretty spot by the lake. it's a museum parking.
sound of running water from the water mill.

name: Grenen beach parking
description: beach parking. access to the beach 20m away.

name: free ribe trailer park
description: 500m from the City center. no services. Well known place so it might be full sometimes.

name: Slettestrand
description: Parking lot just behind the dunes 100 m from the beach. There are no facilities except from public restrooms in a building on the opposite side of the street. I have not camped here but I've spent several months this summer in Slettestrand and seen it's popular with the campers. There's a short distance to a few restaurants.

name: Amager Metro
description: Directly at the Metrostation Amagerstrand. A few parking spaces directly infront of the station and many more in the quiet sidestreets. If full just drive to the next Station of the M2 Metro. Quiet night (the metros here are VERY quiet). Perfect for a city trip. 5 Stops till the city centre

name: Tårs
description: This is a camper dealer that offers overnight parking for 50 kr. You find Vendelbo Vans on the adress Damhusvej 23, 9830 Tårs. The parking lot is just behind the exhibition building a few hundred meters down the Industrivej. They have a dump station with potable and rinse water. A laundromat is also available.

name: Grenen top of Denmark parking
description: Parking lot in Grenen next to the most northern point of Denmark. Nice and very quiet. Some danish bird watchers spoted  around. It was free when we where there (end of mai). In high season it costs 150 DK (probably from June). There is a restaurant , kiosk and a toilet next to the tourist point.

name: Stevens Klint
description: Parking, 20 DKN 18-24 o'clock, 20 DKN 0 - 10 o'clock, 40 DKN 10 - 17 o'clock. Toilet near by. Very nice place with playground, Restaurant and a beatiful view (very near by).

name: Kelstrup Plantage - øst for Hønsnapvej
Aeduvik Camping Färöe Island
description: Very nice campground next to the sea. Highly recommended! Kitchen, hot shower, toilet, laundry, electricity. Very clean. Friendly owner and beautiful surrounding. 200 DK/2 P.

name: Marina
description:
Campervan parkingsite next to 
private harbour. Directly on the sea. There is free water and toilets. Camping fee is 160DKK~24 $
You can rent bikes for free to visit the city.  Open 24/7 with self Check-in  via credit Card.

name: parking place
description: nothing special just a big parking place I am deal for camper vans bus

name: Møns Klint Resort and Camping
description: Nice campsite within walking distance to the chalk cliffs. In the high season a bit expensive but everything is included in the price, including washing machine. Italian restaurant and a small supermarket are available. Free choice of location on the beautiful grounds. Perfect starting place for all nature lovers. Free and good Wi-Fi.

name: Hanstolm parking near the beach
description: Big parking lot directly behind the dunes or up the hill. Many surfers stay here due to easy access to the beach.

name: Cold hawaii parking
description: Not sure if you could stay overnight, but it‘s totally fine to park for the day (free) while you‘re on the water. Cold shower and toilet in the building on the left

name: Ticks at Kelstrup Plantage - øst for Hønsnapvej
description: Watch out for ticks! There are plenty of them. I just walked 20 meters and back and found five crawling on my legs. Use repellent and if you are spending time in the forest do use long trousers and stuck them in to your socks or boots.

name: Shelterplads ved Kongeåslusen
description:
Great camping spot right next to the dike.
Only suited for tent-based camping since vehicles can’t be parked on the site but rather in a parking area alongside the road 50 meters from camp.

name: Gals Klint Camping
description: Large campground on the water next to a forest reserve. When we arrived it appeared to be very crowded, but we got a private space by the forest with a great view of the water. Low season in Denmark starts in early August when kids go back to school. We paid low season rate of €26 for two with a rooftop tent. Electricity is additional. WiFi is additional. Very clean bathrooms. Pay by the minute for showers. €0,30 per minute.

name: Minnislyst Camper Site - on a farm
description: Great place. Good value in Denmark, which isn’t easy to find! Perfect for vehicles with their own toilets, but we stayed in our rooftop tent. There is a small campsite set aside near the entrance to a private farm: 6 spots separated by small hedges on grass. Covered area with table, chairs and BBQ. You pay 75 DKK or 10€ cash in an envelope by the honor system. (Paypal also possible). Included is a space to park, fast WiFi, water and electricity. But NO TOILET or shower. Peaceful. Some road noise.

name: Farm at Tverstedvej Road, 41
description: Camping in a grassy field at a farm. Cost is €16 or 120 DKK, which is about half of the price of campgrounds. Payment directly to the family, Louise (very nice!) and Martin, or leave exact change in a mailbox. Camping is next to a field of sunflowers, a horse pasture, and a field of Christmas trees. Very pretty! Power available. Picnic tables. Clothesline. Bathroom with one shower and one toilet. Very convenient to the Hirtshals ferry to/from Norway.

name: Street Parking Near Metro
description: This whole street has parking with no restrictions. I wouldn't bring anything other than a van or a truck camper. It's nice, residential and has a metro at the end of the street.

name: Under The Bridge Minus The Billy Goats
description: Parking lot just under the bridge and beside the water. Picnic tables and toilets plus a boat launch. The traffic is a bit loud on the bridge but after a while you don't notice. Nice spot.

name: Parking near the Beach Hvide Sande
description: Parkinglots near the Beach in Hvide Sande

name: Parking lot near Torshavn
description: Ferry coming from Iceland to Feroe arrives in the midfle of the night. We found this parking lot not so far of downtown where we could sleep with our Defender for the rest of the night. OK for big rigs

name: Parking lot around cultural house
description: Big area to park with car or trailer just in front of the bay. When we came here (July 13th) toilets of cultural center where not opened, but 300 meters further there were other toilets (maybe from the harbour) free.

name: Close to the beach parking in Fjaltring
description: Parking 100 meter from the beach. Direct parking at the beach possible but forbidden from 11:00 pm to 6 am for campervans. Toilet, shower and a barbecue place available. Toilet and shower were closed in December. Nice walking possibilities at the beach and in the dunes.

name: Iller Strand
description: An open field right next to the coastal road, fits several vehicles, toilets are 600m up the road, fire place as „kitchen“

name: Next to the smokehouse
description: If we were traveling here in our campervan and overnight parking would be allowed in Denmark ... This would be the place. Nice spot overlooking the sea next to the smokehouse. Probably crowded in the summer.

name: Klintebjerg Havn
description:
Sep 2019: Showers were closed due to unknown reason.

Nice spot directly in the harbour. Free toilets, hot showers (in changing room), picknick tables. staying overnight for one night is allowed. Facilities are also open in winter.

name: Camping for cyclists outside Copenhagen
description: There are multiple campsites in this forest, these coordinates are where the majority are with a water spigot and outhouse.

name: windsurfing camp
or.auto
description: small mechanic place -reparation of any thing that has a motor😊

name: Skagen Harbour
description: 6 parking spaces dedicated to motorhomes. Can park overnight for free between September and May. June to September pay at machine. Easy access with short walk into town. Lots of bars/ cafes & restaurants. Ok for overnight. Toilets nearby

name: Flyndersø
description: Public parking area in the middle of a grazing area.

name: Annebjerg Skov (South)
description:
One of the forests in Denmark where you’re actually allowed to camp for one night. You’re not allowed to enter the forest with a motor driven vehicle, so either you have to go deeper in by foot or pitch a ground tent next to the parking. A RTT is probably ok as well. Campers and so on is for me unknown. This POI is positioned in the south end of the The Annebjerg skov. The permission to stay over night is valid for the whole forest north of the marker.

Rules says maximum 2 tents with three persons in each, no more than one night. You’ll find all the blessed sites and rules at https://naturstyrelsen.dk/naturoplevelser/overnatning/. Link goes to Danish text, but you can also find it in English in the menu.

name: Udby skov
description:
One of the forests in Denmark where you’re officially aloud to pitch a tent for the night. Here you can find lots of different places that might suit your demands. In the northwestern corner you’ll find a camp site which according to the map shall have a water tap, long drops and (confirmed) shelters. We stayed the night in the northeastern corner.

Rules says maximum two tents, no bigger then three persons each, for the maximum of one night. Webpage is in Danish and shows all the possible free outdoor overnight places. Shelter as well as blessed forests. English can be found in the menu.

Watch out for ticks!

name: Elkaergardvej Parking Free Camp
description: Grassy parking surrounded by bush and trees for people who wanna use the nearby picknick area or beach. The entrance to the picknick area is not  accesible for cars. Little building with toilets and water. No no signs. Camping on the beach is not allowed though.

name: Ilskov
description: Nice place near forestier. Use only small 4x4. No facilities. Quiet

name: Ebeltoft, Dianavej
description: A quiet place right at the beach. You are in the middle of nature.

name: Slettestrand
description: Near forest and fields. Quiet for 1 car. Only 4x4. No facilities.

name: Tornby
description: Little park place env. 10, picnic tables, water, toilette. Stay waiting boat from Hirthsals to Iceland.

name: Gyldendal Havn
description:
At this small harbour there is several options. 
1: Free open shelters just above the harbour. There is 3 of them with grill and firepit. You can park right next to them. even an enclosed area for horses.
2: Free tent area next to the kayak club
There is is parking very close.
3: Mobile home parking with  electricity included. 130 kr per night.

there is open toilets and free hot shower in the toilet building and if you pay for the mobile home parking there is free WiFi.
Great views and 2 km to small store in Lihme.
These gps coordinates are for the shelters. Mobile home parking and tent area is at the North end of the harbour.
very quiet area even on a Saturday night Highly recommend.

The harbour rents out bicycles for 20 it per day, 100kr deposit.
and the kayak club rent out sub boards (175 kr PR day) and kayaks (250kr or day)

name: Mandehoved
description: Beautiful place stayed here overnight no problem, very quiet at night. There are toilets, rubbish bins, picnic tables as well as a water tap outside the toilet block. If you want to fill up your camper you would need two hoses as you cannot drive in and park next to it. Enjoy the peace and quiet.

name: next to the marina
description: Lots of places available with view of the marina. There is lots of fun for the kids as the beach is right next to it. Rubbish bins provided and showers at the beach. Stayed here a couple of nights no problem, not suitable for rigs over 8metre.

name: Roskilde Fjord
description: Plenty of park benches and garbage bins, 2 fire places BYO firewood and old-fashioned dunny. There is no water tap, if you need water grab a bucketful from the lake. This place is very clean and maintained by the Roskilde council as such we should all keep it clean.

name: Christiansfeld
description: Very large and clean parking area with public toilets. A supermarket is next to the parking lot  and great restaurants are within walking distance. Petrol stations are nearby. This place is very quiet at night.

name: Klintholm
description: Small parking lot close to the beach. Free parking. There is a place to pitch tents as well. Toilet and trash bin on site.

name: Ristinge
description: Gravel road that ends in a roundabout with parking space for a few rigs. Primitive toilet facilities.

name: Vestbyen
description: About 1km from The City centre.  Across the road is a supermarket and next to the parking is a large park.  Marina is 200m away.  Parking is Kr7 an hour (€1) from 08.00 to 19.00.  We paid kr45 for 24 hours.   Restaurants at the marina.

name: Parking Lot Next To The Ferry
description: Huge parking lot with sea access. Nice when you arrive late in denmark because of the ferry. There were many other campers here.

name: Night At The Dune
description: Gravel parking lot for a few campers. Go the gravel road up at the parking lot. Hidden from the road. We had a good but windy night here. Restaurant in walk distance next to the camping.

name: Camping Thorager
description: Nice camping and friendly owner. Everything was perfect clean. Perfect fire place with free wood. 13Euro/night (2+van+dog) Recommended.

name: Fano Paradise
description: Parking lot next to the forest-playground. Toilet with running water! Potable water at the parking next to the main street (55.38966, 8.423613 ). Perfect spot to search amber stones at the beach. Beach in walking distance (30min). But you can also drive down and drive on the beach:-) We spent here two quiet nights.

name: Camping Klitten
description: Campground in the south of fano. 13Euro/night&person. Dog is free. You have to pay for the shower 2DKK/min, but it is start/stop. Friendly owner.

name: Slipshavn
description:
A little visited historically important place for the country Denmark.
Very quiet place on road by fjord and belt. Open countryside, with water on both sides and views of the Great Belt Bridge.

name: Nibe Camping
description:
Very nice campsite at the beach. Perfect place to stay especially if you travel with light equipment. They have a kitchen with everything you'll need.
Might be windy here...

Has a nice restaurant at site with tasty meals.

name: Egeskov Castle Free camping and 24h parking lot
description: There is an official free camping spot available for 2 nights. The parking of Egeskov Castle also allows motorhomes to spent the night. There is a toilet and shower (need a token bought in the shop of Egeskov Castle, 5dkk) on the campingsite. There are 3 power outlets in this building.

name: Seaside wild camp
description: A lovely quiet spot on the beach. No facilities but has the opportunity to do some great walks. About an hour’s drive from Aarhus. Not sure if its officially allowed to camp here but it seems a popular spot to do so.

name: Bageriet Max
description: Best bakery in town. try the "træstamme" or one of the Danish "rugbrød". Free wifi.

name: Cliff & Graveyard
description: There's a small graveyard nearby. We stayed there for one night and slept in the van. Tenting is maybe possible. Haven't looked for toilets. Stunning view! Just don't get too close to the cliff.

name: Nab Strand Camping
description:
Nice Campground.
For Tents, and campers.

Tents in front row with sea view.

name: Drejby Strandcamping
description:
Nice Campground, 
relatively big and expensive - but you get something for it!
Nice Kitchen, Washing rooms and electricity at most spots.
Nice view and beach!

name: Drejby Strandcamping
description:
Nice Campground, 
relatively big and expensive - but you get something for it!
Nice Kitchen, Washing rooms and electricity at most spots.
Nice view and beach!

name: Rygårde Strand
description: Direct access to a long sandy beach. A choice between parking on gravel lots and a huge grassy area. Some benches and fire pit around.

name: Kayak and bicycle camp
description: Small campsite establishes by private owner for  kayakers and bicycle tourists. The small dirt road that leads here is doable in most vehicles but big rigs may be a problem in wet season or high season. 25 dkk pppn. Bring cash or use Mobile Pay (danish pay service).

name: Camper parking/stellplatz
description: Gravel parking area for campers. Toilets and water available. Sea view and close to the beach. 140 kr pr vehicle per night.

name: Madesøvej 15
description:
Beautifully located in the nature. Access to water.
1 shelter available or use your tent or car.
Please contact owner on +45 40420015 for permission to camp on the property.

name: Free range eggs
description: 30 eggs for 35kr. At a large farm and a pretty drive.

name: Beach Camping
description: 50km CarBeach. A lot of spots between the dunes. Quit at night. Showers and toilets at the entry points to the beach.

name: Camping Tonder
description: The place is ok all facilities. Near Tonder Center, a nice old town.

name: LessIsMore overlander refuge
description:
All travelers are welcome at our home and we will do what we can to help if you need it. 
We are between adventures and have settled in Vildbjerg for a while.
We have space for tents in the garden and a few cars in the driveway. And if you truck is not a monster it should fit too.
Safe inside parking for motorcycles and bicycles.
We can offer a warm shower and would love to share traveler stories.
wifi, electricity and cold beer is of course always available.
If possible please send us a message beforehand otherwise just knock on the door. Text/WhatsApp +45 23952332 email: esbenboell@gmail.com

We are looking forward to meeting you.
Camilla and Esben

name: Tent Camp NP Thy
description: Public tent camp with fire pit and parking. Hiking, cycling and mtb tracks start from here.

name: Svinkløv Camping
description: Very nice and large official camp site offering everything you will probably need.

name: First Camp Lakolk Strand
description: very clean campingsite with averege size of camping spots, but very windy, a prizelist is added in the photos. at the entrance is an supermarket

name: Omme A Camping
description:
Wonderful small campsite with large-sized spots and very friendly owners, Very clean sanitary. 
Wheelchair friendly!!!
We paid 245 DKR for one night for 2 adult and electricity.

name: Strand Parken Camping
description:
We stayed here for  one night and payed 280DKR for 2 adults + tent + car + electricity.
Santairy is extremely clean and luxurious 
for the shower you have to pay 10DKR for 5 minutes of water,
BBQ on your spot is possible if you do it off-ground 
we didn't ask for Wifi because you had to pay extra.

name: Restaurant Big World
description:
very tasty food (chinese and meat).
The evening buffet is from 17u,-21u30 for 138DKR on sunday and 158Dkr on the other days. the chinese food is extremely good compared with Belgium.
the size of the drinks are big.
I don't recommend the fries though.

name: Beach
description: Nice beach spot close to Aarhus. Nice grassy spot right next to a sand beach. Quiet and beautiful at night. Apparently there are public toilets but haven't used them. Plenty of space.

name: Fårup Sø Camping
description:
stayed for one night and payed 296 Dkr incl. 15min shower(25Dkr) for 2adults, a tent and electricity.
everything is good except the shower-stream is very very hard.
on the lake there is a vikingboat who is used at day for trips across the lake.
we didn't pay for wifi. also there is a mini-market at the reception.
there is also a swimmingpool

name: Picnic area
description:
There's a nice picnic and BBQ area in the woods next to Arden village. Public toilet available with running water 24/7 (push the handle up and turn the knob to lock it). Cleaner and gardener came by early in the morning but didn't bother us. Plenty of parking space. Quiet at night. It was raining so we didn't explore the surrounding area. May be a nice starting spot for hikes. 

There's a sink with running water, too, but can't connect a hose to fill a tank. Not sure if camping is a allowed here. Anyway, there a re no restrictions or signs posted.

name: Beach
description: Nice gravel spot next to the sand beach close to Skagen. If you continue on Damstedvej there's a parking spot with public toilets and beach access.

name: Bildsø camping
description:
Stayed here for one night and pay 245 Dkr (detail added with the photos.
Small camping with nice spots that is quiet except for the road that runs next to it. sanitair has had its besy days but it works
also there is a very small mini-market at the reception. because of the dry weather BBQ is not allowed by our tent, but the haven an open fire in the center op the camping

name: Kalundborg camping
description:
We arrived here pretty late (22:15), the reception was already closed, but a nice old lady who was a regular client of the campsite gave us the number of the owner who immediately opened the door in a very friendly mood. it was no problem at all to stay for a night or more.
we paid 213.75 Dkr (29.50€) for one night, 2adults,a tent, incl.20Dkr for the showers and 1Kwh (=3Dkr) electricity. sanitair is a bit old but works fine.
A small camping with large spots. also a mini market at the reception.
and even we arrived very late, he asked us if we needed breakfast,but we didn't order that.

name: Shelter near faxe strand
description:
a beautiful shelter area right by the sea and a parking lot at 50m trough the woods.
currently closed due to covid-19

name: E4 heinos campings
description: we stayed here for two nights, and paid 7.5€ for one adult/night and 5€/night for electricity and paid 5€ for 4showercoins(each5min) lots off animals run around as you can see in the photos, chicken, rabbits, pigeons, turkey and also 2 peacock. The sanitary is pretty old, and not very clean, but it works fine, the spots are big sized. The owner comes by at the evening to collect the fee. As you arrive you can just pick a spot in row A,B or C

name: Caravan stellplatz - Place for caravans
description: Gravel parking place without service, directly at the sea. Nice .

name: secret lovers beach
description: A small secret and very private beach with a lot of sand and a possibility to swim. It's quite and no one is here, perfect to make love!

name: ballum camping
description: A nice small campground. 30 euro per night. You have to pay extra for internet and showers. Do not book or reserve before head because they will charge you extra 5 euro for that.

name: vilsund öst
description: near a very good restaurant,expensive and a small harbour. 3 places.

name: Mando Brugs Camping
description: Campground on the island Mando, you can get there at low tide with your car, the camping has a couple of fields

name: Ilbjerg
description: Next to swim lake, next to mountain bike track, and more stuff to explore in the area:)

name: Stjerne camping
description: Okay camping place with everything you might need. The beach is about 1,5 kilometers away.

name: Sdr. Søvndal
description:
the square is located by a typical Danish village. You can spend the night here in a tent or car. you will have a view of a river valley and fields. There is the possibility of access to toilet and water if we are at home. The area is quiet and you can move without risk. There is a basis for a nice walk in the woods and on the meadow.
You are wellcome to contact me before you arrive. +4530659089.

name: Ulslev StrandCamping
description: Place directly on the Baltic Sea with a supermarket, bike rental, washing machines, laundry driers and kitchen rooms.

name: Odden Havn
description:
Official campsite of the harbor, now. Beside the lot with the three shelters, where also about 8 tents can be put up, there is now a lot for about 12 camper vans/rv’s (caravan trailers not permitted). View over the sea. A water tap and electricity for 12 parties are on site, toilets, showers and WiFi at the harbor 75 m away. 
Fee for camper vans/rv’s is 180 DKK per night including use of facilities. Tents and use of shelters is for free.
Restaurant in the harbor area about 150 m away.

name: Two sitting shelters on Sheep paddock.
description: Ok to stay for one night. You can pitch up your tent between the trees, or in the shelters. In the morning people will walk there with dogs, and younger people sometimes drink there during night.

name: Randers City Camp
description: Nice camp ground. 120 Krones for a tent. Showers included. Wifi extra costs. Check other prices in pictures.

name: Ålbæk Bed & Breakfast
description: Nice, small and cheap camp ground. 75 Krones for a tent. Showers for free. Wifi only at the building where the owner lives. No kitchen, I think it was closed due to Corona.

name: Øhavs view
description: Close to Trebjerg, a view point in the area - you can see the ocean. Camp closer to a local smaller road

name: Fynshav Badelaug
description: Toilets, parking, electricity, water. A good place for a few days. 350kr the night.

name: haarby helnäesvej near a small harbour
description: entering the spot take directly the spot on the right. Nice place with a beach

name: parking at the road to mandø
description: the parking is set quite pittoresque at the beginning of the low-tide road to mandø, the road is gravel, and a bit spectacular. sleeping/vancamping seems ok to passing cars, friendly reactions. no water, no shops, great sunset, tasty wildcollectable seaweed.

name: Parking lot near hotel Havgrim
description:
Next to hotel Havgrim, on of the few parking lot with unlimited time to park. So no one will tell you to go!
Excellent for one or two nights, especially if you have to catch or when arriving with the 3:00 am ferry from SmyrilLine.
Very quiet despite close to the road, and super convenient 10th walking distance from the marina and city center.
View of the sea!

name: Near Nørre Vorupør
description: Parking area close to the beach tucked up against the dunes. Nice flush toilet building with sinks and garbage cans. Overnight camping allowed. Potable water spigot. No other amenities. Strong cell service on Google Fi.

name: Beach south of Skagen
description: Informal camping area along the dunes with garbage cans and toilets at the end of the road. There are about 6-7 spots along the road where you can pull in-between a gap in the dunes and practically camp on the beach. There are also 9-10 spots in a parking area at the end of the road near the toilets. The beach spots were full when we arrived at 5pm on a weekday so we opted for a grassy pullout. Excellent cell service on Google Fi.

name: Skamling Camping
description:
Campground in a beautiful park like setting. Access to nice walking trails. Sanitary building with hot showers, toilets and dishwashing sinks. No wifi but strong service on Google Fi
 Paid 160 krone for two people and a small truck camper.

name: City Camp
description: Large parking area for any size rig or tent close to Copenhagen. 5 minute bike ride or 20 minute walk to the city center. Clean toilets, hot showers and wifi included in the base price of 30 Euros for two people and a camper. Not a beautiful place but convenient for exploring the city. One criticism is that the toilet block is individual units with a combined showers and toilets which means in the evenings and mornings when people are showering there's always a line for the toilet. On site host is very helpful and informative. Can book in advance by email. Payment in cash when you leave.

name: bakari
description: Great little bakery. They have a good selection of sweet things and some great sourdough breads.

name: Mikladalur
description: Nice communal campground. Gravel and Grass area. Space for some 10 RVs. Toilets and warm shower, very clean. Access to kitchen restricted. Excellent view. Price: 150 Krone for two persons.

name: Ro naturcamp
description:
Super nice campsite right next to the sea. Not the typical Danish campsite with a big grass lawn. Here you can find lots of privacy especially off school holidays. Toilets, shower and a kitchen are included and a nice little shop with great coffee! The island is pricy, so is the ferry to the island. 

Check out season openings at https://www.ro-naturcamp.dk.

name: Hirtshals
description:
Port to sail to east Iceland



Le port d'embarquement pour l'Islande Est

name: Parking on the öresund
description: Parking without facilities. A great place on the sand.

name: Askovvang
description:
We have a grass field with space for car, tent, camper or truck. Water, electricity, toilet, bath and internet is available when we are at home.
Indoor car repair may be possible.  (for Overlander etc). 
Phone in advance. +45 2060 7035

We are not an official caravan-site. We are just doing it for fun :-) 
We prefer people on foot, bike, motobike, 4x4 and overland-trucks.

name: Transportcenter
description: Water and Dump Station near the petrol station

name: Walking trail
description: Easy 2,5hr Nice walking trail along the bay

name: Stanges Auto
description:
Auto repair shop
For all car manufacturers

name: Middelfart Community motorhome parking
description: Free RV parking with an excellent view of the sea. Very nice, clean and quiet with a toilet and a couple of picnic tables. Maybe 6 parking spaces up to approx. 6,6m in length (and a few 3hr only spots).  4g signal.  There's a trail to walk along the shore.

name: Parkland parking lot
description: Large gravel, slightly sloping lot used mostly by cyclists using the paths in the park.  No signage prohibiting overnight parking.  There are 3 lakes to walk around.  No services, but a picnic table.  A bit of distant road noise during the day.  4G signal.  Quiet at night.  3 other motorhomes here with us.

name: Autocamperplads Svanemollen
description:
Harbour side RV park.  Gravel lot (E) for about 20 campers. However, the place is often crowded and you should walk in to look for a free site before buying the ticket. Park before the barrier on the right and walk in to check.  You buy the ticket at a machine in the passage of the black building next to that same parking lot on the right.   You will get a ticket with the code for the barrier.  There are two bathrooms but we used our own.  At the back of the harbor basin (the building with a second floor white balcony) is the second washrooms/showers, with the disposal for the toilet on back side of the building (it's a small room with just an open PVC pipe - there is a short hose for rinsing). Unfortunately, there is no way to dispose of gray water. A harbor card (which you buy at the same ticket machine) is required for the toilet and shower (50 DKK deposit). 3 minutes of showering costs 5 DKK. Access to the toilet or shower costs 3 DKK each time. We understand you can get a refund if you don't use the whole 50DKK. 

There is a metro station (Svanemollen) about 1km away to go into the city.  

Price was 250DKK per night which includes power, water and WiFi.

name: Hedehøg
description: Close to the beach with toilet. You can See the sea.  Swimming is possible. The cities of Höjer and Hijepsted are close.

name: Quiet parking spot for overnight stay
description: Quiet parking spot for overnight stay. Fits about 4 cars/vans. Tables and benches available.

name: Saeby autocamper
description: Auto campsite at the harbour for one overnight stay, with toilets and shower. Very beautiful view and clean facilities.

name: DCU-Camping naerum
description: camping next to the moterway noise isent to bad hardly notice it

name: Marielyst Ny Camping, Sildestrup Øvej, Idestrup, Denmark
description: nice clean campsite with good facilities

name: near trail to highest mountain of the Faeröer
description: Parking place next to quiet road. 300 meters before the hiking trail to the highest mountain of the Faeröer.

name: Gyrup 2
description:
On farm next to building. Private shower and toilet. Lovely couple (she’s Dutch) Quiet place. 75 dnk p/car
You can whatsapp or call Linda-Mae: 00 45 41 72 82 23

name: Natural camping
description: pretty, very natural campsite.  access to a pretty beach.  The price is very reasonable.  warm welcome and beautiful view of the sea.

name: Super beach
description: simple and very natural campsite.  very clean.  very very nice owner.  beautiful beach with very pure water in the fiord.  a nugget of nature and very quiet.  cheap.  I really like.

name: Graesgard Farmcamping
description: Simple campground with space for three Camper Vans at a small Farm. Beautyful view to Baltic Sea and island Aeroe. 300 meter walk to shoreline. Very friendly hosts, but no additional Services available.

name: Rebaek Strand
description: A quiet place for the night. Bicycle disdance to town. Enough space, also for tents. BBQ place at the beach.

name: Blåbjerg
description: Nice place dir Walking and hiking with markt routes

name: Parking Place Hybenspillet
description: Nice Place vor hikingrounds with dogs near by the nothern sea

name: Motorcycle and Car/Truck Mechanic
description:
Yamaha Motorcycle Dealer that services all bikes and a general car mechanic two shops down the road.

Both very friendly and helpful, made time and helped us us on short notice.

name: Oddesundtårnet Parking
description:
Lots of parking space near bunkers and bridge. No signs prohibiting camping. There is an excellent free toilet and watchtower/museum.
Road nearby but not very busy at night.

name: Rest Area
description: Beautiful rest area between the trees. Unpaved road but easy for any vehicle. Big vehicles have to park in the grass so be careful. There’s a table and trashcan, and spots to make a fire.

name: Ringkøbing Haven
description: Nice Place with nice View an very good sea food

name: Hadsund
description: Clean sani/dump in the open. In the small harbour.

name: Forrest at the sea
description: Nice spot next to road and see, place for 3-5 vehicles, campfire on beach

name: Kongsdal Lystbådehavn
description: At this harbour, they created a parking for bigger campers, right at the shore. But if you are in a car with tent or smaller vehicle, you can drive up a narrow dirt road and camp on a big grassland with plenty of room for vehicles and tents, and with great views!!! Campsite costs 130 dkr per vehicle (payable at a ticketing machine). Toilets are free and very clean. Hot showers are 5 dkr per 3 minutes. Big communal area to hang out and relax when it's raining. Very quiet at night.

name: Danur Campsite
description: At the end of a spectacular road, you will find the small village of Danur. For the campsite, head down to the sea and you cannot mis it. It's a grassy field next to the community hall and a sport/soccer field. Instructions and prices (175 DKK per night per vehicle) are within the toilet/kitchen building. It also states an account number where you can transfer the money to, but if you wait some time, often the owner comes for a chat and you can pay with him in cash (is preferred). We paid 100 DKK, as we didn't need electricity. Toilets and showers (20 DKK for 10 minutes) are clean, and you can sit inside and use the kitchen. Good WiFi.

name: West side of Fureso
description: Several campsites along the west side of the lake. No reservations allowed - these are first-come, first serve. Can get busy in the summer. This is one of the areas in Denmark where you don’t need to book sites in advance.

name: Ferry Port - Sorvagur to Mykines
description: Mykines is very expensive and locally known as a "tourist trap", with hardly any birds to see. Better to wait and go see the birds in Iceland (for free).

name: Grenaa Lighthouse
description: Beautiful parking lot at a secluded beach in Grenaa, picnic tables for BBQ available.

name: Free - Jerslev Sogn, 140 Håndsbækvej
description: with fredh water, wc, you can put Somerville tents

name: Free water & dump station
description: free water at the end of the gas station

name: Storkesøen Naturecamping
description: Well organized campground with good ablutions next to a fishing pond. 20 min. walk into town. Campervan with 2 adults app. €30, power included.

name: Beach with pebble stones
description: Small parking lot at a secluded beach with a view of the cliffs. Space for 4 campers

name: Grenen Strand
description: Well organized large campground with good facilities next to the beach. Spots in various sizes and prices. Expensive. We paid DKK 470 for a campervan with 2 adults. Power and (slow) internet are always included.

name: Rubjerg Knude Dune
description: This is a small Tent-Place beyond the Dune with the legendary lighthouse. There are official path-signs telling you how to get here. Pretty quiet through day and Night.

name: Farø Parkingspot
description: Big parking spot with beautiful view at the water and a big bridge. Rather quiet. Little noise from the street. Drinking water, toilets and latrine for the campertoilet. picnictables. Car charging stations.

name: Tornby Strand Camping
description:
Campsite close to Hirtshals and ferry terminals

Price: 180 DKK for 1 car with rooftop tent (1p)

name: Shelter near Aalborg
description: Two sleeping shelters, one for animals, one for coming together with a fireplace, a toilet and water

name: Shelter near Løkken
description: Shelter without walls but it has a table, benches and a fireplace.

name: Københavns Autocamper Park
description: Very well organized camper site, need to make reservation in web page. Bus at the Doors to connect to train and visit the city, very convenient. Very helpful staff.

name: Skærbæk Familie Camping
description: Very nice campground, big spots, quiet, good for kids (they have goats and playground). Facilities are clean and water is drinkable. It has all you need. We paid 75 DDK for person.

name: Kjul Strand Camping
description: A nice campground with a small store, clean restrooms and showers when taking the ferry to and from Norway.  Short walk to the beach.

name: Haderslev Campground
description: Grassy terrain along lake separated by hedges. Excellent facilities including washing machine, dryer, dish washing place, charging station for electrical vehicles and kitchen.

name: Røsnæs Fyr - parking lot
description:
Parkinglot at Røsnæs Fyr with good opportunity for hiking, and swimming in clear water. A public toilet is at place. Very quiet at night.
The lighthouse Røsnæs Fyr houses a little museum on the history of the place, and the tower can be mounted.
There is also a little shop, that sells coffee, cake and souvenirs.

name: Corona Camping
description:
Was here just passing through. Stayed one night with bike. Payed 80  Danish kronas. Absolutely love the vibe. Very friendly people all around. After i was shown my camping spot I noticed a fire place and asked for some fire wood. I insisted to be charged for the wood but owner refused to take money. This place is not for everyone. Rough on the edges. Read reviews on google and you will get the idea. 
For me the bad bit was the motorway noise that was fighting with crickets.

name: Camping Absalon
description: Large, well equipped , established campground.   Easy 25 minute bike ride to downtown.   Complete facilities.   Fresh water and dump station.

name: Shelter by the lake
description: This is a shelter next to the small lake. There's a fire pit, a toilet with fresh water, picnic tables and a big roof to sleep on some wooden platforms. Perfect to have a nice night of rest.
